WRITING.TEXT: Obligatory "kakagising lang. lakas ng hangover ko from last night" comment.
80's!! Sobrang earworm ng mga kantahan nila inay at itay noon.
[Hi.](http://imgur.com/a/sRLtL)
Pwede pa ba mag transfer sa inyo?? I've been thinking of transferring pero feel ko kasi mahirap na dahil sa K12.
Lalo na yung may mga gimmick pa na naka middle finger or may hawak na bote ng red horse. That just shows lack of professionalism. Good luck sa paghanap nila ng trabaho.
*Kantutan na ignition* *kahit anong klaseng position*
Kung gagamitin nila "Creep" lagi sa pag promote ng tour I'm sure lots of people will watch haha.

Mas gusto ko yung Oslo performance ng "True Love Waits". It's less sadder than the studio version.
Familiar ako sa Atoms for Peace and Thom's solo gig. I'll give it a listen.
After ng concert ng Coldplay in Manila, I kept wondering kailan sila pupunta dito. :(
I'm still enjoying every bit of *A Moon Shaped Pool*. It's pure art. "Decks Dark" is my favorite track from the album. The melody just levitates your ears to transcendence.

Well I've been listening to Radiohead for almost three years now but I haven't gone through to their entire discography. *Amnesiac*, *Hail to the Thief*, and *Pablo Honey* (I only like one song from it. Make one good guess ano yun haha) nalang di ko pa napapakinggan ng buo.
I'll give it another listen then. "Morning Mr. Magpie" is a close second. That intro just makes me want to dance. And that "Lotus Flower" music video? Thom can turn the weird into sexy.
Nice guide. But I could never get myself into sa *The King of Limbs*. It just feels... weird and disjointed. "Lotus Flower" is my personal favorite from the band though.
You won't regret listening to Radiohead. Pag asa *OK Computer* ka na, I highly recommend listening to "No Surprises" first.
Buong araw ko nirerecommend Radiohead sa RD so... Radiohead?
"Pang budget meal na," according to my gay classmates.
*Fuck these other niggas*
Futurama.
I only know "Creep" and "Anyone Can Play A Guitar" from their first album. I thought *The King of Limbs* was a harder album to absorb. "Lotus Flower" lang ata maganda dun.

Well it depends on your music taste. Their albums vary in genre which is great I guess. If you want some feel good pop rock songs, go with their *The Bends* album. *OK Computer* and *Kid A* for melancholy. But if you just want some chill love songs, I highly recommend their *In Rainbows* album.
"No Surprises" - Radiohead
I thought "Just" had a feel good vibe. "Motion Picture Soundtrack" and "How To Disappear Completely" makes me want to sit in a corner and just cry all day though.

Song is so sad it just goes back to being happy. It's a catharsis! But on a side note, more people should explore Radiohead's discography. They really have good music. Most people only know "Creep" :(
If you feel down today, may I suggest listening to some [Radiohead](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u5CVsCnxyXg)

God I wouldn't even call it a meme. It's just another dumb gimmick people are doing on social media. So anyway, it started I think with a student from TUP posing on a mountain during his "vacant". The early gimmicks looked amusing and believable at first but things got out of hand when other schools started overdoing it.
I'm so fed up with the "Saan Aabot Vacant Mo?" challenge. Saw an fb post with a whole group of students dressed in uniform sa beach. It was sooo overdone to the point na ang cringy na nila.

WRITING.TITLE: What happened with 24: Legacy?
WRITING.TEXT: I heard the season finale's today but I stopped after three episodes. Did it ever get better or was it even worse than 24 Season 6?
Westworld was one of the best shows last year. It had a beautiful soundtrack as well. Hoping for Ramin to win an Emmy someday. He deserves it.
Extratorrent and PirateBay are good alternatives but I would recommend the latter. I still download shows from there.

Yes. The main title was actually made by the guys who did GoT's and Westworld's as well. Sadly, no. I don't think Starz is available in the country but I'm sure some channel will carry show locally. I would suggest *sailing the high seas* nalang if you know what I mean.
Same!! But I suggest you should just torrent it. How do you watch other shows ba?
Never read the book but I'm just so hyped for this show. Mostly because of the cast. Gillian Anderson is back on Sundays, baby!!
Reading advanced reviews of American Gods. I'm so hyped for this show! It's something to fill the void while waiting for GoT.
